[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Integer Overflow] At line 69, total_borrow_usd_value accumulation could overflow if the account has massive borrows across reserves - is this checked? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Underflow Protection] At line 78, the subtraction total_supply_usd_value - total_borrow_usd_value is protected by the check at line 74 - but can rounding errors cause the condition to pass while still causing underflow? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Precision Loss] mul_with_oracle_price() at lines 65-66 divides by ORACLE_DECIMALS (1e18) - can this cause precision loss for small balances, incorrectly reporting 0 value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Rounding Error] When converting supply_scaled and borrow_scaled from u256 to u256 at lines 65-66, can casting cause truncation for very large ray_math values? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Multiplication Overflow] At lines 65-66, supply_scaled * price could overflow u256 before division by ORACLE_DECIMALS in mul_with_oracle_price() - is this possible? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Zero Division] If ORACLE_DECIMALS is somehow 0, mul_with_oracle_price() would divide by zero at lines 65-66 - is this constant immutable? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Negative Value] Lines 74-76 check if total_supply < total_borrow and return 0 - but does this hide insolvency, allowing underwater positions to be valued as 0 instead of negative? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Off-by-One Error] The loop at line 43 starts with i = storage.get_reserves_count() and checks 'while (i > 0)' then uses 'i - 1' - could this skip reserve 0 or access invalid reserve i? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Loop Bounds] At line 37, get_reserves_count() returns the count - if this is 0, the loop never executes and returns 0 value even if positions exist - is this correct? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Infinite Loop] If i somehow doesn't decrement properly at line 71, could the loop become infinite causing DoS? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Skip Logic] Lines 58-61 skip when supply == 0 && borrow == 0 - but what if only one is 0? Will it still process, or should it skip to save gas? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Loop DoS] If storage.get_reserves_count() is very large (thousands of reserves), will the loop consume excessive gas causing transaction failure? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Reserve Ordering] The loop iterates from highest to lowest reserve index (line 43 decrements i) - does this order matter, or could it affect accumulation results? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Continue Statement] Line 60 uses 'continue' after decrementing i - could this skip important state updates or cause inconsistencies? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Reserve Skip] If get_user_balance() at line 44 returns (0, 0) for all reserves, the function returns 0 - is this distinguishable from an account with no positions vs all positions closed? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Reentrancy] Storage is passed as &mut at line 34 and accessed multiple times (lines 44, 48-52, 56) - can an attacker exploit reentrancy if any of these calls allow external interactions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [State Consistency] If storage is modified during the loop (e.g., another transaction updates reserves), could this cause inconsistent valuations between iterations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: update_navi_position_value()] [Storage Mutation] Vault is passed as &mut at line 14 - can an attacker call this function multiple times concurrently to create race conditions in vault state? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Index Manipulation] dynamic_calculator::calculate_current_index() at lines 48-52 takes &mut Storage - can it modify storage state in a way that affects subsequent loop iterations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Storage Corruption] If get_user_balance(), calculate_current_index(), or get_coin_type() fail midway through the loop, is storage left in a consistent state? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: update_navi_position_value()] [Account Ownership] account_cap.account_owner() at line 22 returns the Navi account address - but does it verify that this account actually belongs to the vault and not an external account? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Address Spoofing] The account parameter at line 32 is passed directly to storage.get_user_balance() - can an attacker pass an arbitrary account address to value someone else's position? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: update_navi_position_value()] [AccountCap Validation] Does get_defi_asset() at line 20 verify that the NaviAccountCap's account_owner() matches the vault's expected account, preventing attackers from substituting a different account? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Zero Address] If the account parameter at line 32 is address(0) or an invalid address, will get_user_balance() return 0 or fail? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: update_navi_position_value()] [Value Update Race] finish_update_asset_value() at line 28 updates the vault's asset value - can an attacker race multiple update calls to overwrite values in a specific order for advantage? (Medium)
